content.title: E-YUVA Scheme: BIRAC’s E-YUVA Fellows (for under graduate students)
content.details: The scheme 'Empowering Youth for Undertaking Value Added Innovative Translational Research (E-YUVA)' is started by the Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC) to promote a culture of applied research and need-oriented (societal or industry) entrepreneurial innovation among young students and researchers. The scheme provides funding support (through fellowship and research grant), technical and business mentoring, exposure to bio incubation model, orientation to an entrepreneurial culture, etc. to students at various levels including undergraduates, post-graduates, and post-doctoral.
benefits: Quarterly Stipend: INR 7,500/- per quarter per student of the team
Annual research grant: INR 2,50,000/- per team
Continuous mentoring support including Technical Mentoring, IP Support, Legal Support, Networking and Outreach, Training, Regulatory Advice, Business Mentoring, and Fundraising.
eligibility: Indian students from Indian Institutes/colleges who are pursuing under graduation in any domain should apply as a team.
A team should comprise a minimum of 3 and a maximum of 5 Indian students from Indian Institutes/colleges pursuing under graduation in any domain.
Teams with students from different disciplines are encouraged.
One team can have students from the same/different colleges/institutes.
The team should be supported by a mentor/guide.
content.application_process: Online application submission needs to be done through the BIRAC website.
documents_required: Identity proof i.e. Aadhaar Card, PAN Card etc.

faqs.question: What is the 'E-YUVA Scheme'?
faqs.answer: The scheme 'Empowering Youth for Undertaking Value Added Innovative Translational Research (E-YUVA)' was started by the Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC) to promote a culture of applied research and need-oriented (societal or industry) entrepreneurial innovation among young students and researchers.

faqs.question: What is the 'BIRAC’s E-YUVA Fellowship'?
faqs.answer: The 'BIRAC’s E-YUVA Fellowship' is a category under E-YUVA Scheme where a team of students pursuing under graduation can apply to pursue their research work at their College/University labs.

faqs.question: How many fellows can be at Each EYC?
faqs.answer: Each EYC will support up to 5 teams with up to 5 students each every year.

faqs.question: What is the duration of fellowship?
faqs.answer: Fellowship is provided for a period of 12 months.
